page.title: 07CLOPTON BRIDGE
page.content: Sir Henry Clopton Knight, Lord Mayor of London built Clopton bridge.In the reign of King Henry the seventh.(1485- 1509).The bridge is the main road out to the south from Stratford.It is very busy.A traffic survey taken on Wednesday 15th May at 1.30p.m.to 1.50 p.m. shows that 725 vehicles used the bridge.Of these 435 were leaving. Stratford becomes very conjested during the summer season because of tourists and the traffic often blocks up the gyratory system ( a one way system for vehicles )due to sheer volume of traffic.We saw seven coaches in twenty minutes during our survey which shows the large amounts of tourists visiting Stratford.On the town side of Clopton Bridge is the small bus station which serve Stratfor d and surrounding villages.
